15#ifndef ISC_PARSEINT_H
16#define ISC_PARSEINT_H 1
17
18#include <inttypes.h>
19
20#include <isc/lang.h>
21#include <isc/types.h>
22
23/*! \file isc/parseint.h
24 * \brief Parse integers, in a saner way than atoi() or strtoul() do.
25 */
26
27/***
28 *** Functions
29 ***/
30
31ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
32
33isc_result_t
34isc_parse_uint32(uint32_t *uip, const char *string, int base);
35
36isc_result_t
37isc_parse_uint16(uint16_t *uip, const char *string, int base);
38
39isc_result_t
40isc_parse_uint8(uint8_t *uip, const char *string, int base);
41/*%<
42 * Parse the null-terminated string 'string' containing a base 'base'
43 * integer, storing the result in '*uip'.
44 * The base is interpreted
45 * as in strtoul(). Unlike strtoul(), leading whitespace, minus or
46 * plus signs are not accepted, and all errors (including overflow)
47 * are reported uniformly through the return value.
48 *
49 * Requires:
50 *\li 'string' points to a null-terminated string
51 *\li 0 <= 'base' <= 36
52 *
53 * Returns:
54 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
55 *\li #ISC_R_BADNUMBER The string is not numeric (in the given base)
56 *\li #ISC_R_RANGE The number is not representable as the requested type.
57 */
58
59ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
60
61#endif /* ISC_PARSEINT_H */
62
